page.title: 15Education in Swineshead
page.content: There is no school in Swineshead so children from the village have to travel to surrounding villages to get their schooling. Pre-school children have the choice of going to various playgroups in the area; Pertenhall, Kimboltonor Little Staughton. Most go to Pertenhall playgroup, where they can start as young as 1 year old, providing mum goes along as well. When they are 3 years old, they go to playgroup 2 mornings a week, and are taught nursery rhymes and otherbasics. Most children then go on to Riseley Nursery School, which is attached to the Primary School. The Nursery School is a gradual introduction to school life.After moving through Nursery and Primary School, children move up to Middle School and then onto the Upper School whhich is at Sharnbrook.
